name: Hotel Baltimore Paris - MGallery Collection

reviews.text: In December 2008 I went to this hotel with my Mum booking rooms well in advance and requesting connecting rooms (Mum is not that much young anymore and I wanted to give a look at her anytime) underlining this request twice. When we arrived at the hotel, we were told that all the connecting rooms were sold out but that we had been given superior rooms. I told the receptionist that I didn't give a damn about superior rooms but I did wanted connecting rooms as per my booking. She replied that all those rooms were sold out since midday so I'd better not bother her with discussion, Again I specified that connecting rooms were confirmed in the booking and again she repeated not to bother her with discussion. At this point I walked out the door, took my car, drove around the neighbor and found a wonderful hotel with connecting rooms. I went back to the Baltimore, canceled the booking without paying an euro (and they didn't say a word about it), greeted them and told them they would never see us again.
reviews.title: Rude rude staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel this summer and I really enjoyed it! The location is great! just 15 minutes walk to the Arc de Triomphe! And just in front of the hotel there's a subway station and several brasseries where you can eat at a reasonable price! The room is bright with a really nice balcony facing Kleber Av and the bed is very comfy! Most hotels in Paris have small beds, but this one was a king size bed! The bathroom is ok but I found the tub too high for some people to step over comfortably. Hotels in Paris are overpriced and are not as nice as this one! It worth staying in! For a romantic break is great! I would really recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from a week long trip to Paris. Hotel Baltimore is a very comfortable and stylish hotel. We enjoyed an incredible breakfast each morning of our stay, with scrambled eggs that were elevated to an art form. The hotel has free wifi, a bar and Michelin rated restaurant.
reviews.title: Lovely & Relaxing Hotel

reviews.text: The location is fantastic, close to the Eiffel Tower, the Arc de Trimophe and my personal favorite, action hero Jason Bourne's Paris apartment located at 104 Avenue Kleber. There are several local restaurants nearby and one in the hotel. I did not eat dinner at the hotel. I did eat at Cafe Kleber and Rallye Etoile. I enjoyed them both. There is also a market around the corner for cheap drinks and snacks.
reviews.title: PERFECT LOCATION!! VERY EFFICIENT STAFF

reviews.text: Just half a block away there is metro stop Boisierre which makes traveling a snap. Honestly, I was terrified to take the Paris subway at first for fear of getting lost. It was a snap much easier to navigate than the NY subway system.
reviews.title: Thanks for making Paris feel like home....
Friendly hotel in heart ofParis
reviews.text: We stayed in the Baltimore in December 2010. Friendly staff, good rooms if not too big. The hotel is centrally located near subway station: Bossière. The service at breakfest needs some improving but overall service was very good, especially the concierge. Definitely recommendable.
It's not easy to get my mom's approval on hotels but this charming place made us all happy. Modern, well-proportioned (for Europe) rooms. Very clean and smelled great thanks to their candles.
reviews.title: Travelled with my picky Mom and her best friend - Hotel 100% approved!

reviews.text: I have already recommended this hotel to friends.
reviews.title: Good location, quiet room, otherwise just OK

reviews.text: The room was nice, large size for Paris & looked recently decorated, which was odd since the bathroom was old fashioned and grubby! Room very quiet at night despite central location - 5-10 min walk from main sites.
reviews.title: excellent location,staff,food and rooms-would stay again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was just ok - I was here with work and would not have paid €300+ per night to stay here - would recommend the secret hotel in Paris (see my other reviews) as much better value for money
reviews.title: A gorgeous little hotel in a brilliant Location

reviews.text: The Hotel Baltimore MGallery is a 103 room hotel located right in the center of Paris and is withing walking distance to the Eiffel Tower, Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elysee. It has an ideal location for sightseeing and exploring Paris. The hotel is elegant and the check-in staff was friendly and efficient. The Baltimore has a small bar and a restaurant. The fitness facility is quite small with one treadmill, one stationary bike and a weight machine. During my stay the treadmill was readily available and the fitness room did not appear to be overcrowded.
reviews.title: Price Value Expectations not met

reviews.text: The rooms are very small, but then this is a given in Paris, and follow an elegant and a bit plush style. The room amenities provided meet the expectations of a hotel in this class, offering bath robe, slippers, mini-bar and internet access (for fee). No iron or ironing board though. What cleanliness is concerned the rooms get a definite minus though. The bathroom was plainly filthy and unacceptable for a €250 charge per night. Even though the style of the room followed the elegant theme of the hotel, it was worn and there were signs of usage everywhere (chipped furniture, which then is no surprise given the small size of the room). The water adjustments in the shower and bathroom sink required very fine motoric skill in order to reach an appropriate temperature. The chaulking in the bathroom was also disgusting (and I am not coy). The bed was great though with the nice feature to have a quilt underneath the bedsheet, which made sleeping there almost like resting in a cloud.
reviews.title: Nice boutique, but expensive
paris holiday
reviews.text: The breakfast buffet was decent, but at €26 totally overpriced. The restaurant staff in the morning was a bit indifferent and required approaching them rather than being serviced. Once asked the service was fine though.
To end on a positive note, I want to point out that the bell staff was great, kind and efficient.
reviews.title: Fantastic Classy Boutique Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At €300 per room not including breakfast, I thought this hotel was a little expensive. But the rooms weren't cramped like a lot of other places in Paris and the location proximate to the subway, Trocadero Place and the Champs-Elysee was very good. If you stay here, I strongly recommend venturing toward Avenue Victor Hugo where you will find beautiful patisseries, boulangeries, delis, fruit shops, butchers, seafood shops and poultry shops that locals actually use - in quite a few of those shops the English spoken by shopkeepers will be minimal at best, but the produce is beautiful.
reviews.title: Magnificent hotel and exceptional staff

reviews.text: Enjoyed our stay. Staff very effective and friendly. Could not fault the service and the location is great. Our room was due some attention; cracked tiles in the bathroom and no chest of drawers, minor points if addressed in time.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay. Staff very effective...

reviews.text: Staying at this hotel was a good first experience for my son. We took the Metro from Charles de Gaulle and the line en route provides quite a breathtaking view of the Eiffel Tower. It is within walking distance of the Arc de Triomphe and Trocadero, the latter being a great spot for taking pictures of the tower. It is very easy to get around from this location and has lots of good places to eat, whether you are looking for fine dining or an informal dinner.
reviews.title: Ideally located hotel with great staff

reviews.text: The staff was generally nice and helpful. There was one gentleman at the front desk who neither smiled or greeted guests the whole time we were there but this did not put us off and overall we enjoyed all the amenities offered.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in a quiet location with views of Eiffel Tower

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we had two adjoining rooms with a door to the hallway so we could leave our individual room doors open. The rooms were huge with little balconies that we could step out on. From there we had views of the top 1/3rd of the Eiffel Tower. The hotel is on Ave Kleber with Boissere metro right across the street. 5 minutes walk to Palais De Chaillot and the Eiffel Tower. 15 minutes walk to Arc De Triomphe. The avenue gets very quiet after 9pm but we walked up and down Kleber 3 nights in a row and never felt unsafe.
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.text: The hotel was lovely--great location and a clean, tastefully decorated room but a bit small. The staff was very friendly. The buffet breakfast was wonderful with many choices.
reviews.title: Excellent .... You should visit

description: Hotel with multilingual staff; set in a Townhouse dating from 1892; located in city center, 1 km from Eiffel Tower.
